intro: Leptopus hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan leptopus, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
